title: Chapter 0-4 : Journey to Irinipolis - Part IV

lines: For two more days, we travelled with the refugees along the road, seeking safety in an unfamiliar city.
But even after the run-in with bandits, we wouldn't be able to rest easy.

lines.Vitus: "What's going on?"

lines.Volesus: "All the supplies are stolen! Including our weapons and food supply!"

lines.Vitus: "Stolen? Who did it?!"

lines.Volesus: "It was those bandits! They made a run for it with our resources!"

lines.Cerkles: "Maybe I was too gentle on them... I'm sorry..."

lines.Mukaki: "We all know it's all because of that self-righteous idiot!"

lines.Makari-Hari: "Some bad luck doesn't mean you should abandon justice."

lines.Mukaki: "We aren't lacking of luck! You're lacking half a brain!"

lines.Volesus: "There are some people missing. The other refugees said they were scared of our power..."

lines.Mukaki: "How stupid! What is there to be scared of when you have great powers protecting you?"

lines.Makari-Hari: "Clearly the obvious possibility that we may use that power against them someday. It's ours, not theirs, after all."
"This is how the mortals think, which is why I'm not at all surprised."

lines.Mukaki: "This is hilarious! I don't think I can ever understand what's in their heads."

lines.Makari-Hari: "Which is precisely what put it into this situation."

lines.Mukaki: "I ought to wipe that smug scowl off your ugly face..."

lines.Vitus: "All right! This doesn't help us. What are our options now?"
"We won't make it to the city without any food."

lines.Makari-Hari: "I would... rather not entertain this option, but—"

lines.Mukaki: "The last artefact! Hah— sounds like the perfect time!"

lines.Makari-Hari: "Even though that may be the case..."

lines.Volesus: "Wait! Would it actually be the holy chalice from that legend?"

lines.Mukaki: "The hell are they calling him now?! Say that to his face and he'll die laughing!"

lines.Makari-Hari: "That's the reason why I... Whatever, if you must summon him, do it."

lines.Mukaki: "You presume I wish to deal with him? But fine, I am not afraid of a little chaos."

lines.Vitus: "I'll summon him this time."

lines: (Vitus draws a magic circle in the dirt and places the holy chalice within it.)
(Focusing, he repeats the incantation— a laughing figure materialises in a bright flash.)

lines.Zermes: "Hahahaha! Zermes, the greatest rouge in history hears your call!"
"Try not to be too overwhelmed, summoners, though nobody will blame you when you are."
"Wait. What the hell? I didn't expect such a grand reception..."
"Both demiurges are here!? What's going on?"

lines.Vitus: "Let me explain what's going on here first."

lines.Zermes: "Supplies got stolen? Hmm... That's indeed something I can help with. Alright, hand me my chalice."
"This is all I need. Come on, stick you paw in it!"

lines.Vitus: "I can try."

lines: The holy chalice begins to fill with silvery-blue glaze, like beautiful sparkling water.
And at the bottom, a loaf of bread appears.

lines.Vitus: "Huh? Bread?"
"Oh, it smells great."
"And it's not even soggy!"

lines: Volesus excitedly puts his paws into the holy chalice...
...but wrinkles his face when he only pulls out a bunch of damp hay.

lines.Zermes: "Heheh— Bad luck! At least your pack beasts won't starve."

lines.Volesus: "But how... what about that empty chalice could conjure anything from within it?"

lines.Mukaki: "Because Zermes is the only one who can awaken the power of that chalice."

lines.Makari-Hari: "Why the chalice acknowledges Zermes of all people is beyond me."

lines.Zermes: "It's only natural! I am nothing but chartiable."

lines.Vitus: "So if we gather the others..."

lines.Zermes: "Go gather me a crowd and let the raffle begin!"

lines: (The refugees line up in front of the caravan, each dipping their paws into the chalice one by one.)
(Soon the group had many things— food, weapons, tools, decorations, and even a few monera.)

lines.Vitus: "We may be okay with supplies for now, but..."
"What about the bandits that ran away?"

lines.Makari-Hari: "We're going to catch them, of course! They deserve to be tried and punished accordingly!"

lines.Mukaki: "Come on, how do you still have that kind of energy after this? Just let them go."
"It's just you haggling over every little coin."

lines.Makari-Hari: "What they did is almost starve our Crown Mages. So you would compare their lives to a single coin?"

lines.Mukaki: "Tell me— you capture them again, and then what? Nannying some bandits is a wasted effort."

lines.Makari-Hari: "We must let people know we're to be taken seriously! Otherwise what if someone steals our belongings again?"

lines.Vitus: "All right— All right— You two won't come to a compromise without our intervention, will you?"

lines.Volesus: "Then Vitus, let us pick sides and work this out together."

lines.Vitus: "Right, this time I want to follow..."
"Then what about the refugees who ran away?"

lines.Makari-Hari: "We are going to catch them and bring them back, of course!"

lines.Mukaki: "What's the difference? Just let them go. Maybe they will get killed by other bandits."

lines.Makari-Hari: "Which is why you find them and put them in custody! What if they come back and take advantage of us again?"
"Power like that is what they fear! That's why they want to flee! You need to teach them to behave!"

lines.Mukaki: "It's exhausting to teach others how to think... why can't we just live our lives?"

lines.Vitus: "I guess we can't avoid another fight between these two, then."

lines.Volesus: "Then Vitus, let us pick sides and work this out together."

lines.Vitus: "Right, this time I want to follow..."

lines.Volesus: "Okay. Then I will represent Mukaki's interests to our travelling companions."

lines.Vitus: "Then let us begin."

lines: (Vitus convinces the refugees that they should capture those who escaped.)

lines.Herclaus: "Then it's settled. I will gather some volunteers and hunt them down."

lines.Cerkles: "I'm sure I can persuade some of them to help our cause."

lines.Krokos: "I have no reason to stay behind."

lines.Zermes: "Haha— I bet the lot of them will regret messing with a couple of Crown Mages!"

lines.Volesus: "Okay. Then I will represent Makari-Hari's interests to our travelling companions."

lines.Vitus: "Then let us begin."

lines: (Vitus convinces the refugees that they should continue forth, ignoring the escapees.)

lines.Vitus: "So let us forget them and move on."

lines.Herclaus: "So be it then. We won't chase after those thieves."

lines.Krokos: "It's the boring option, but probably for the best."

lines.Cerkles: "I am unsure about leaving them behind... Those who are afraid will do what they need to survive..."

lines.Zermes: "What you don't need is far more interesting to me."
"If somebody owns something, I tend to believe there's a decent reason for that."
